get.description: Lists the currently available models, and provides basic information about each one such as the owner and availability.

post.description: Creates a model completion for the given input prompt.

get.summary: Get a custom model by short name
get.description: Get a custom model model by short name

delete.summary: Delete a model by short name

get.summary: Get a custom model by full name

get.summary: Returns URL with link to download file content

post.description: Creates a job that fine-tunes a specified model based on a given dataset.

Get status updates for a fine-tuning job.

index.title: Index
index.description: The index of the choice in the list of choices.

message.description: A chat completion message generated by the model.

finish_reason.description: The reason the model stopped generating tokens. This will be `stop` if the model hit a natural stop point or a provided stop sequence, `length` if the maximum number of tokens specified in the request was reached, `content_filter` if content was omitted due to a flag from our content filters.

logprobs.description: Log probability information for the choice.

id.title: Id
id.description: A unique identifier for the chat completion. Each chunk has the same ID.

choices.title: Choices
choices.description: A list of chat completion choices. Can contain more than one elements if `n` is greater than 1. Can also be empty for the; last chunk if you set `stream_options: {"include_usage": true}`.

created.title: Created
created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the chat completion was created. Each chunk has the same timestamp.

model.title: Model
model.description: The model to generate the completion.

system_fingerprint.title: System Fingerprint
system_fingerprint.description: This fingerprint represents the backend configuration that the model runs with.; Can be used in conjunction with the `seed` request parameter to understand when backend changes have been made that might impact determinism.

object.description: The object type, which is always `chat.completion.chunk`.

usage.description: An optional field that will only be present when you set `stream_options: {"include_usage": true}` in your request.; When present, it contains a null value except for the last chunk which contains the token usage statistics for the entire request.

type.title: Type
type.description: The role of the author of this message.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the content part.

type.title: Type
type.description: The role of the author of this message.

content.title: Content
content.description: A list of message content tokens with log probability information.

role.description: The role of the author of this message.

name.title: Name
name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role

tool_calls.title: Tool Calls
tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

tool_call_id.title: Tool Call Id
tool_call_id.description: Tool call that this message is responding to.

name.title: Name
name.description: Specifies the name of the function the model should call.

type.title: Type
type.description: Specifies that the tool choice is a function.

function.description: Details the specific function to be called by the model.

model.title: Model
model.description: ID of the model to use.

store.title: Store
store.description: Whether or not to store the output of this chat completion request for use in our model distillation.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. [Example Python code](https://cookbook.openai.com/examples/how_to_format_inputs_to_chatgpt_models).

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description:
The maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the completion.

The token count of your prompt plus `max_tokens` cannot exceed the model's context length. [Example Python code](https://cookbook.openai.com/examples/how_to_count_tokens_with_tiktoken) for counting tokens.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description:
What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

We generally recommend altering this or `top_p` but not both.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or `temperature` but not both.

n.title: N
n.description:
How many completions to generate for each prompt.

**Note:** Because this parameter generates many completions, it can quickly consume your token quota. Use carefully and ensure that you have reasonable settings for `max_tokens` and `stop`.

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: If set, partial message deltas will be sent, like in ChatGPT. Tokens will be sent as data-only [server-sent events](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events/Using_server-sent_events#Event_stream_format) as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]` message. [Example Python code](https://cookbook.openai.com/examples/how_to_stream_completions).

stream_options.title: Stream Options
stream_options.description: If set to {"include_usage": True}, usage stats will be sent with the last chunk of data[Example Python code](https://cookbook.openai.com/examples/how_to_stream_completions)

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description:
Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far,increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

[See more information about frequency and presence penalties.](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text-generation/parameter-details)

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description:
Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

[See more information about frequency and presence penalties.](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text-generation/parameter-details)

logit_bias.title: Logit Bias
logit_bias.description:
Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion.

Accepts a JSON object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the GPT tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

As an example, you can pass `{"50256": -100}` to prevent the token from being generated.

logprobs.title: Logprobs
logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the `content` of `message`.

top_logprobs.title: Top Logprobs
top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. `logprobs` must be set to `true` if this parameter is used.

user.title: User
user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help us to monitor and detect abuse. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices/end-user-ids).

response_format.description: Similar to chat completion, this parameter specifies the format of output. Only {'type': 'json_object'} or {'type': 'text' } is supported.

guided_json.title: Guided Json
guided_json.description: If specified, the output will follow the JSON schema.

guided_regex.title: Guided Regex
guided_regex.description: If specified, the output will follow the regex pattern.

guided_choice.title: Guided Choice
guided_choice.description: If specified, the output will be exactly one of the choices.

service_tier.description: The service tier to use for the request.

id.title: Id
id.description: A unique identifier for the chat completion.

object.description: The object type, which is always `chat.completion`.

created.title: Created
created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the chat completion was created.

model.title: Model
model.description: The model used for the chat completion.

choices.title: Choices
choices.description: A list of chat completion choices. Can be more than one if `n` is greater than 1.

usage.description: Usage statistics for the completion request.

service_tier.description: The service tier used for the request.

role.description: The role of the author of this message.

tool_calls.title: Tool Calls
tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

index.title: Index
index.description: The index of the choice in the list of choices.

delta.description: A chat completion delta generated by streamed model responses.

finish_reason.description: The reason the model stopped generating tokens. This will be `stop` if the model hit a natural stop point or a provided stop sequence, `length` if the maximum number of tokens specified in the request was reached, `content_filter` if content was omitted due to a flag from our content filters.

logprobs.description: Log probability information for the choice.

content.title: Content
content.description: The contents of the chunk message.

role.description: The role of the author of this message.

tool_calls.title: Tool Calls
tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

logprob.title: Logprob
logprob.description: The log probability of this token, if it is within the top 20 most likely tokens. Otherwise, the value `-9999.0` is used to signify that the token is very unlikely.

bytes.title: Bytes
bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token. Useful in instances where characters are represented by multiple tokens and their byte representations must be combined to generate the correct text representation. Can be `null` if there is no bytes representation for the token.

top_logprobs.title: Top Logprobs
top_logprobs.description: List of the most likely tokens and their log probability, at this token position. In rare cases, there may be fewer than the number of requested `top_logprobs` returned.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

function.description: Defines a tool the model can call, specifically a function in this context.

logprob.title: Logprob
logprob.description: The log probability of this token, if it is within the top 20 most likely tokens. Otherwise, the value `-9999.0` is used to signify that the token is very unlikely.

bytes.title: Bytes
bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token. Useful in instances where characters are represented by multiple tokens and their byte representations must be combined to generate the correct text representation. Can be `null` if there is no bytes representation for the token.

model.title: Model
model.description: ID of the model to use.

loras.title: Loras
loras.description: List of publicly accessible LoRAs compatible with the selected model

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: A text description of the desired image(s).

width.title: Width
width.description: The width of the generated image(s) in pixels.

height.title: Height
height.description: The height of the generated image(s) in pixels.

num_inference_steps.title: Num Inference Steps
num_inference_steps.description: Number of denoising steps in the diffusion process. Higher values generally result in higher quality images but take longer to generate.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Random seed for image generation. Use -1 for a random seed.

guidance_scale.title: Guidance Scale
guidance_scale.description: Guidance scale for the model. Higher values make the image adhere more closely to the prompt.

negative_prompt.title: Negative Prompt
negative_prompt.description: A text description of the non-desired image(s).

response_extension.description: The format of the output image(s).

response_format.description: The way output image will be returned.

index.title: Index
index.description: The index of the choice in the list of choices.

text.title: Text
text.description: A completion message generated by the model.

finish_reason.description: The reason the model stopped generating tokens.

model.title: Model
model.description: ID of the model to use.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The prompt(s) to generate completions for, encoded as a string, array of strings, array of tokens, or array of token arrays.

stream_options.title: Stream Options
stream_options.description: If set to {"include_usage": True}, usage stats will be sent with the last chunk of data

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

n.title: N
n.description: How many completions to generate for each prompt.

logprobs.title: Logprobs
logprobs.description: Include the log probabilities on the `logprobs` most likely tokens, as well the chosen tokens. So for example, if `logprobs` is 5, the API will return a list of the 5 most likely tokens. The API will always return the `logprob` of the sampled token, so there may be up to `logprobs+1` elements in the response.

echo.title: Echo
echo.description: Echo back the prompt in addition to the completion.

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty
presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty
frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

logit_bias.title: Logit Bias
logit_bias.description: Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion. Accepts a json object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

user.title: User
user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse.

service_tier.description: The service tier to use for the request.

id.title: Id
id.description: A unique identifier for the chat completion.

object.title: Object
object.description: The object type, which is always `text_completion`.

created.title: Created
created.description: The Unix timestamp of when the completion was created.

model.title: Model
model.description: The model used for the chat completion.

usage.description: Usage statistics for the completion request.

service_tier.description: The service tier used for the request.

model.title: Model
model.description: ID of the model to use.

input.title: Input
input.description: Input text to embed, encoded as a string or array of tokens.

encoding_format.title: Encoding Format
encoding_format.description: The format to return the embeddings in. Can be either float or base64.

user.title: User
user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user.

service_tier.description: The service tier to use for the request.

model.title: Model
model.description: The model used for the embedding.

service_tier.description: The service tier used for the request.

object.title: Object
object.description: The object type, which is always 'list'

has_more.title: Has More
has_more.description: Whether there are more jobs to fetch

model.title: Model
model.description: The name of the model to fine-tune

training_file.title: Training File
training_file.description: The ID of the uploaded training data file

validation_file.title: Validation File
validation_file.description: The ID of the uploaded validation data file

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: The seed controls the reproducibility of the job

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: List of tags to associate with the job

extra_body.title: Extra Body
extra_body.description: Extra params to pass to the fine-tuning job

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: The parameters the function accepts, described as a JSON Schema object. See the guide for examples, and the JSON Schema reference for documentation about the format.

strict.title: Strict
strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the function call. If set to true, the model will follow the exact schema defined in the parameters field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when strict is true.

lora.title: Lora
lora.description: Whether to use LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation) for training

packing.title: Packing
packing.description: Whether to use packing for training

url.title: Url
url.description: Either a URL of the image or the base64 encoded image data.

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: Specifies the detail level of the image.

object.title: Object
object.description: The object type, which is always 'list'
The object type, which is always `list`.

data.title: Data
data.description: A list of currently available models.

id.title: Id
id.description: The model identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

created.title: Created
created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the model was created.

object.description: The object type, which is always 'model'.

owned_by.title: Owned By
owned_by.description: The organization that owns the model.

base_model.title: Base Model
base_model.description: The base model identifier the new model belongs to

source.title: Source
source.description: Checkpoint id from Fine-Tunes API, file id from Files API, or HuggingFace repo url

ModelStatus.title: ModelStatus
ModelStatus.description: Enum representing the possible statuses of a model.

ServiceTier.title: ServiceTier
ServiceTier.description:
Represents the service tier for requests.

Attributes:
    Auto: Automatically choose the best available tier for the request (Default or OverLimit).
    Analyze response to determine which tier was used.
    Default: Return 429 errors on hitting the rate limit, do not exceed to the OverLimit tier.
    OverLimit: Indicate that the request was over the user limit.
            This tier cannot be set by user in the request, but us used in a response for tier=Auto.
    Flex: Do not consume rate-limit credits, but run with lower priority. May still result in 429 errors
    in case of if there is no resources to process.

completion_tokens.title: Completion Tokens
completion_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the generated completion.

prompt_tokens.title: Prompt Tokens
prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the prompt.

total_tokens.title: Total Tokens
total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used in the request (prompt + completion).
